page.title: 13TRANSPORT Canal 2
page.content: boats had very little living space for a family. The living quarters were a space about 6 feet by 8 feet in which the whole family had to sleep and eat. The children did not go to school.They led the horse, which pulled the barge, along the towpath. At Batchworth Lock there are stone runs sticking out of the ground to help the horse not to slip when going up the slope. There is also a small house, now someone's home which looks as if it used to be a stable. They took paper, gravel and farm produce to London and brought coal and wood back. Westward on the towpath are houses with beautiful gardens, open farming land (pasture) and on the right the Aquadrome. We walked as far as Stockers Lock where there was a traditional lock-keeper's cottage with windows facing up and down the canal.
